description: Number of n-step walks on square lattice in the first quadrant which finish at distance n-3 from the x-axis.
comments: The steps are N, S, E or W.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
R. K. Guy, Catwalks, Sandsteps and Pascal Pyramids, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 3 (2000), #00.1.6. See figure 4, sum of terms in (n-2)-nd row.
Simon Plouffe, Approximations de séries génératrices et quelques conjectures, Dissertation, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Simon Plouffe, 1031 Generating Functions and Conjectures, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (4,-6,4,-1).
formula: G.f.: x^3 * ( 6 - 4*x + x^2 ) / ( 1 - x )^4.a(n) = (n-2)*(n)*(n+1)/2.sum (((n+j-1)^2-(n-j+1)^2)/4,j=0..n). - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Sep 13 2006a(n) = sum(k*(n+1), k=2..n, n>=2. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jan 29 2008a(n) = 4*binomial(n+4,2)*binomial(n+4,4)/binomial(n+4,3) = (n+1)*binomial(n+4,2). - _Gary Detlefs_, Dec 08 2011 [corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 09 2011]a(n) = 4*a(n-1) -6*a(n-2) +4*a(n-3) -a(n-4). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 18 2012
example: The n=4 diagram in Fig. 4 of Guy's paper is10 49 0 60 16 0 410 0 9 0 1Adding 16+4 we get a(4)=20.The a(3) = 6 walks are EEN, ENE, ENW, NEW, NSN, NNS. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 09 2014G.f. = 6*x^3 + 20*x^4 + 45*x^5 + 84*x^6 + 140*x^7 + 216*x^8 + 315*x^9 + ...
maple: A005564 := proc(n)        (n-2)*(n)*(n+1)/2 ;end proc: seq(A005564(n),n=0..10) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 09 2011A005564:=(6-4*z+z**2)/(z-1)**4; # _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation
prog: (PARI) a(n)=(n-2)*(n)*(n+1)/2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 12 2011(MAGMA) I:=[6, 20, 45, 84]; [n le 4 select I[n] else 4*Self(n-1)-6*Self(n-2)+4*Self(n-3)-Self(n-4): n in [1..45]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 18 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 06 2012
